title: 103_hr372
content: AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS FOR ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ADMINISTRATION PROGRAMS: The Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 is amended to authorize $200,000,000 for fiscal year 1993. Additionally, the Small Business Administration 1993 program levels are increased by 50 percent, and a tax credit is introduced for employers hiring individuals within 1 year after enactment. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to provide Economic Recovery Hiring Incentives, where individuals hired within 1 year after enactment are treated as a targeted group with increased tax credits. The amendments made by this section allow for substituting higher wages for employees, with an effective date for new hires after the enactment of the Act. Tax-free withdrawals from individual retirement accounts are allowed for purchasing or refinancing a home. Tax-free withdrawals from individual retirement accounts are permitted for purchasing or refinancing a home under a new amendment to the Internal Revenue Code. Tax-free withdrawals from individual retirement accounts are allowed for qualified acquisition or refinancing costs related to a principal residence within a 1-year period from the enactment date. Qualified acquisition costs include expenses for acquiring, constructing, or reconstructing a residence, along with settlement, financing, or closing costs. The amendments made by this section apply to payments and distributions made after the enactment date of this Act. SEC. 5. DELAY IN OBLIGATIONS OF CERTAIN DEFENSE, FOREIGN ASSISTANCE, SPACE, AND ENERGY RESEARCH PROGRAMS. SEC. 5. DELAY IN OBLIGATIONS OF CERTAIN DEFENSE, FOREIGN ASSISTANCE, SPACE, AND ENERGY RESEARCH PROGRAMS. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no funds may be obligated during fiscal year 1993 in excess of specified amounts for various programs including the M1 Abrams Tank program, space flight activities of NASA, general science and research activities of the Department of Energy, and provisions of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. During the period from enactment to September 30, 1993, funds are allocated for the V-22 aircraft Osprey program and the Inter-American Foundation's functions as per specific sections of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1969 and title 31, United States Code.
